Carly, best known for her viral ex-Mormon related content across Instagram and TikTok, shares her raw, funny, and thoughtful reflections on leaving the Mormon Church, navigating motherhood, sexuality, and personal growth. Whether you're in the middle of your own faith crisis or just curious, you're in the right place.

episodes.title: The Mountain Meadows Massacre - Quick Facts (w/ Historian Barbara Jones Brown)
episodes.description: Welcome to a recap of the multi-part series on The Mountain Meadows Massacre with historian, author, director of Signature Books, content editor of the award-winning "Massacre at Mountain Meadows" and co-author of "Vengeance Is Mine, The Mountain Meadows Massacre and Its Aftermath" Barbara Jones Brown! In this live steam we ask Barbara the quick facts on the Mountain Meadows Massacre, a tragic event in Mormon history where a group of Mormons in 1857 killed a large group of innocent men, women, and children. With Destiny begging to Manifest in the 1850s, the US government was hot for an economic and cultural superiority expansion. Mormons had their backs! Or DID they? Here's the overview of all the forces at play that led otherwise sane people (hold your jokes) to commit heinous acts of violence on innocent people. episodes.title: What's Next After Deconstructing Religion? (w/ Brittney Hartley)
episodes.description: In this special second episode with Brittney Hartley, we dive into her insightful book, "No Nonsense Spirituality." Brittney takes us through topics such as deconstruction and reconstruction, the tools we choose for ourselves to keep from religion and how to bust out and develop new rituals that we can build off of. We're getting into some deep stuff, from necklace symbols to reintegration and anger roles. Britt shares her unique and brilliant approach compared to the "big 3" ideologies. Who are the players and what are the tools each one offers as well as their shadow sides? We discuss the balance between ideals of less harm and the realities of everyday life, as well as recommendations for books and podcasts for self-exploration. And what about those spiritual experiences? Britt has some of the wisest words I've ever heard. Lastly, cultivating awe in your life! It's a must! Don't miss out on this epic convo about no nonsense spirituality and self-discovery—hit that play button now and hit the link to buy Brittney's book! And join me on the group trip to Greece! episodes.title: Is The Book of Mormon True? Kwaku Sits Down with NuanceHoe
episodes.description: Welcome to this soon-to-be legendary episode of The Mormon History Hoedown in which I interview Kwaku El, known for his staunch defense of Mormonism on Ward Radio, Saints Unscripted, and Jubilee’s Mormons vs. Exmormons! In the ring with Kwaku today, we kick it off with his conversion, liberal background, and perspectives as an apologist in the Mormon space. How did he make that shift, what's his deal and what's with all these a**holes? Moving on, we've got some drama brewing: Ad hominem attacks, DezNat showdowns, and all the tea on what Joseph Smith was really all about. Jumping ahead, let's get down to basics: What even is Mormonism, and how does Kwaku see it compared to the mainstream? Then, we're diving into the nitty-gritty: Kwaku’s version of Mormonism versus the beliefs of the masses. We've got some spicy topics to stir up: Is masturbation a sin, and are Mormons getting it on before marriage? What is "true," and does it even matter? The Book of Mormon – is it historical, or just a good story? We're breaking it down. Plus, we've got some tight vs. loose translation debates and a chat about anachronisms. Stick around as I engage in a spirited debate with Kwaku, the go-to guy for defending Joseph Smith and nuancing the modern LDS church. 👇 👇 👇 I live and die on donor support! So, great news! episodes.title: The Dark Side of Dating My Zone Leader (w/ Suzy Baker)
episodes.description: In this episode, I interview the wise and delightful Suzy Baker, co-founder of The Psychedelic Assembly. We explore her life in Mormonism in Alabama, Utah and New York City, as well as the dark side of dating her zone leader on her mission and the events that led her out of the church. Cozy up with Carah with Suzy for this special reveal of Suzy's mission experience. Serving the Lord? And serving the lust. And shame. A place where hopes, consent, and a whole lot of trauma collide. We discuss the pressure to boost baptism numbers, and the surprising events that led to her zone leader asking Suzy to pray to fall in love with him. We hope this story celebrates the power of humanity and community while dishing out some sage advice on spotting red flags, including what Suzy wishes she could tell her younger self. Suzy's Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/suzycbaker/ Below is a great article from an active support network called Psychedelic Support and they talk about what to look out for when choosing someone to work with in a healing context: https://psychedelic.support/resources/dark-side-plant-medicine/ The Women's Visionary Council is an amazing organization that my dear friend Annie King founded. They have incredible resources about best practices for people using psychedelics in group settings. The below three documents go over:1. Safety Tips: https://visionarycongress.org/articles/wvc-articles/safety-tips-r3/ 2. A Manual of Best Practices for Radical Risk Reduction: https://visionarycongress.org/articles/wvc-articles/manual-radical-risk-reduction/ 3. episodes.title: P. 4 Mountain Meadows Massacre: The Orphans, The Blame & The Cover Up (w/ Barbara Jones Brown)
episodes.description: This is part four where Barbara and I discuss the Mountain Meadows Massacre, a tragic event in Mormon history where a group of Mormons in 1857 killed a large group of innocent men, women, and children. We kick things off with a review of the brutal crime of wiping out all the innocent people including young witnesses. As tensions soar, the Mormon leaders are left reeling at the shocking aftermath of their actions. Lies fly and a frantic cover-up ensues, leaving everyone scrambling to keep their secrets buried. The whole situation blows wide open when freighters stumble upon the scene. Amidst the chaos, questions arise about what the orphaned kids might know and how to make them forget. Things take an even more sinister turn when leaders start bragging about their misdeeds in church and resort to making violent threats, then telling prophet Brigham Young a fictionalized version of events. Pick up the book Vengeance Is Mine from your local bookseller or online: https://www.amazon.com/Vengeance-Mine-Mountain-Massacre-Aftermath/dp/0195397851 Listen to the audiobook of Vengeance Is Mine: https://www.audible.com/pd/Vengeance-Is-Mine-Audiobook/B0C6FPQFB5?eac_link=QUOOMHSekDaE&ref=web_search_eac_asin_3&eac_selected_type=asin&eac_selected=B0C6FPQFB5&qid=xMIVfP7ajx&eac_id=140-1729692-0760619_xMIVfP7ajx&sr=1-3 👇 👇 👇 I live and die on donor support! Pleasure is the measure, so satisfy your longings to hang out with me for an hour of free education from Natasha Helfer, a certified sex therapist! React with us as we watch Girl Defined's most uncomfortable, now deleted, highly controversial video where Bethany interviews Christian "sex counselors" as they detail their path through God-honoring, non-orgasmic, duty-bound sex. In this enlightening video, we take a deep dive into the world of purity culture through the hellscape of Mormonism and Christianity. You've heard of Girl Defined reaction videos, but all pale in comparison to the wise, empathetic education Natasha brings to this discussion for those looking to still deconstruct unhelpful Christian sexual dogmas.

episodes.title: P.3 Mountain Meadows Massacre: Details of The Horrifying Slaughter (w/ Barbara Jones Brown)
episodes.description: I've started a new multi-part series on The Mountain Meadows Massacre with historian, author, director of Signature Books, content editor of the award-winning "Massacre at Mountain Meadows" and co-author of "Vengeance Is Mine, The Mountain Meadows Massacre and Its Aftermath" Barbara Jones Brown. This is part three where Barbara and I discuss the Mountain Meadows Massacre, a tragic event in Mormon history where a group of Mormons in 1857 killed a large group of innocent men, women, and children. Practice self-care, grab a box of tissues, and buckle up for the horrifying story of the Mountain Meadows Massacre as we delve into the tragic events that unfolded on September 11th, 1857. Barbara brings to light the complex and heart-wrenching story of this massacre for listeners with a complete murder-by-murder breakdown for you as you break down. With Barbara's dedication to researching this massacre, giving a voice to the defenseless victims, and her heartfelt storytelling, you'll leave this episode rocked to your very core. We also touch on Barbara's personal journey of uncovering her ancestral connection to this dark chapter in Mormon history. Join us in honoring the memory of the victims and exploring the significant lessons this incident holds for us today. Don't forget to share your thoughts and subscribe for deeper historical explorations on Mormon history. Pick up the book Vengeance Is Mine from your local bookseller or online: https://www.amazon.com/Vengeance-Mine-Mountain-Massacre-Aftermath/dp/0195397851 Listen to the audiobook of Vengeance Is Mine: https://www.audible.com/pd/Vengeance-Is-Mine-Audiobook/B0C6FPQFB5?eac_link=QUOOMHSekDaE&ref=web_search_eac_asin_3&eac_selected_type=asin&eac_selected=B0C6FPQFB5&qid=xMIVfP7ajx&eac_id=140-1729692-0760619_xMIVfP7ajx&sr=1-3 👇 👇 👇 I live and die on donor support! episodes.title: Mormon Vlogger to Rebel: Die Shiny’s Bold Music on Temple Secrets
episodes.description:
Join me for a deeply emotional and candid interview with the members of Die Shiny, Callie Crofts and Zac Bryant, as they share their personal journeys, music, and the profound stories behind their new song "Sacrament." This intimate conversation touches on the impact of Callie's mom's cancer and her eventual passing, the unique dynamics of Colette Butler and Callie's relationship, the influence of the music of their youth, Zac's journey leaving the church, their rise to fame on YouTube, awakening to the falsehoods of the temple, navigating divorce, and their liberation from certain aspects of their Mormon past. Discover the songwriting process behind "Sacrament," its lyrics and symbolism, the unbreakable bond between these remarkable musicians, and the love and support that has propelled their journey forward. 

Sacrament music video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gX2JoACDxgM&list=RDgX2JoACDxgM&start_radio=1

episodes.description: In this second episode of our series, historian Barbara Jones Brown takes us through the violent rhetoric on behalf of Mormon leaders that led up to the Mountain Meadows Massacre. From 1856 to 1857 in Utah, Mormon prophet Brigham Young played a role in shaping the mindset of the Mormon settlers resulting in a theocracy, heaps of polygamy, and the idea that avenging the blood of prophets was the only rational thing to do. Blood atonement and the Mormon Reformation are key aspects to understanding the religious doctrine and context of the time that shed light on the motivations and justifications used by the perpetrators of the massacre. episodes.title: Mountain Meadows Massacre: Secrets of Blood Atonement (w/ Historian Barbara Jones Brown)
episodes.description:
Welcome to part 2 of this intense multi-part series on The Mountain Meadows Massacre with historian, author, director of Signature Books, content editor of the award-winning "Massacre at Mountain Meadows" and co-author of "Vengeance Is Mine, The Mountain Meadows Massacre and Its Aftermath" Barbara Jones Brown!

In this second episode of our series, historian Barbara Jones Brown takes us through the violent rhetoric on behalf of Mormon leaders that led up to the Mountain Meadows Massacre. From 1856 to 1857 in Utah, Mormon prophet Brigham Young played a role in shaping the mindset of the Mormon settlers resulting in a theocracy, heaps of polygamy, and the idea that avenging the blood of prophets was the only rational thing to do. Blood atonement and the Mormon Reformation are key aspects to understanding the religious doctrine and context of the time that shed light on the motivations and justifications used by the perpetrators of the massacre.

Pick up the book Vengeance Is Mine from your local bookseller or online: https://www.amazon.com/Vengeance-Mine-Mountain-Massacre-Aftermath/dp/0195397851

Listen to the audiobook of Vengeance Is Mine: https://www.audible.com/pd/Vengeance-Is-Mine-Audiobook/B0C6FPQFB5?eac_link=QUOOMHSekDaE&ref=web_search_eac_asin_3&eac_selected_type=asin&eac_selected=B0C6FPQFB5&qid=xMIVfP7ajx&eac_id=140-1729692-0760619_xMIVfP7ajx&sr=1-3

episodes.title: Mormon Racism Throughout History
episodes.description:
A clip from my full interview with Benjamin Park: 
Know Your "American Zion"! (w/ Mormon Historian Ben Park)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Ei-si_x2HE&t=1s

You're tired of the bombardment of info. "Just give me the fast facts, chief!" The brilliant Mormon historian Benjamin Park joins me to discuss his new book "American Zion" which details all the facts, context, and characters to provide a brief but in-depth look at the history of Mormonism in America. 
  
You don't know Mormonism until you explore the development and evolution of Mormon traditions over its 200 years and how internal and external conflicts have influenced it. In this episode we get into the religious fervor and experimentation of Joseph Smith's time, the dark legacy of racism, divisions, and culture war over issues like gender equality, LGBTQ rights, and religious liberty, including pivotal moments in Mormon history, such as the introduction and eventual abandonment of polygamy, the struggles for women's rights and racial equality within the church, and the impact of the church's alignment with the Republican party and conservative politics. 

https://benjaminepark.com/

episodes.title: Ex-Mormon Empowerment. The Secrets & Tips (w/ Stephanie Brinkerhoff)
episodes.description:
Watch this video, then watch it again to digest all the wisdom of my guest, Stephanie Brinkerhoff, as we discuss the difficult road to empowerment as an Ex-Mormon.  It's time we get to the heart of the process. 

From leaving a church that took away her autonomy and intuition, and how psychedelics helped her break free, my guest Stephanie discusses associations of safety with following the rules of the Mormon Church. She believed she would feel safe if she ticked off the boxes and followed the teachings. However, after leaving the church and deconstructing her beliefs, she realized that true safety is an internal state of being, a cultivated inner state. A safety that comes from within and involves connecting with oneself, cultivating inner peace, and trusting in one's own intuition. 

With real examples, I hope this episode is useful for everyone still trying to find their power as we answer questions from viewers! And please leave all your experiences with empowerment in the comments! 

For more of Stephanie's goodness, follow her on Instagram at: 
https://www.instagram.com/stephanieannagain/

episodes.title: Mormon Polygamy: Masked Marriages?
episodes.description:
A clip from my full interview with Benjamin Park: 
Know Your "American Zion"! (w/ Mormon Historian Ben Park)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Ei-si_x2HE&t=1s

You're tired of the bombardment of info. "Just give me the fast facts, chief!" The brilliant Mormon historian Benjamin Park joins me to discuss his new book "American Zion" which details all the facts, context, and characters to provide a brief but in-depth look at the history of Mormonism in America. 
  
You don't know Mormonism until you explore the development and evolution of Mormon traditions over its 200 years and how internal and external conflicts have influenced it. In this episode we get into the religious fervor and experimentation of Joseph Smith's time, the dark legacy of racism, divisions, and culture war over issues like gender equality, LGBTQ rights, and religious liberty, including pivotal moments in Mormon history, such as the introduction and eventual abandonment of polygamy, the struggles for women's rights and racial equality within the church, and the impact of the church's alignment with the Republican party and conservative politics. 

https://benjaminepark.com/

episodes.description: Welcome to part 1! Taking on the Israel-Palestine war one piece at a time with the brilliant Lindsay from @socialistlyawkward1443 by my side to break it all down for this multi-part series of The Mormon History Hoedown. First: We deconstructed Mormonism. Now: We unravel our understanding of holy lands and what pieces of empathy were missing in our previous Mormon minds, including the context and history that's been hidden. Join us in this eye-opening series where two curious ExMo gals explore the intricate facets of Zionism, delving into its historical, political, and religious implications. Lindsay and I draw on our own journeys of challenging established ideologies, to take you through the intricacies of Zionism, examining its historical roots, and modern interpretations within the context of what has been unfolding with Israel and Palestine for 75 years. With a fresh perspective, shaped by our experiences breaking free from the confines of one structured belief system, we are proud to bring you the Israel-Palestine breakdown of the century atop our know-it-all high horses. (I know that name-calling and so forth happens a lot when discussing this topic so all comments will need to be approved because I'm counteracting the Marxist accusations sure to come my way by keeping my comment section my own private property.) episodes.title: A Response to That Guy Who Yells at Me + John Dehlin from His Van
episodes.description:
Go tell it on the mountain that Jesus Christ is bored. Exhausted. Fed up. Today I go through some clips of YouTuber and Evangelical to Mormon convert, David Alexander, tell us why Mormon Stories, John Dehlin, and any who leave the Mormon faith are bad, bad Leroy Browns.  

I explain the mind of a Mormon convert. What's up with them?! Many other religions and spiritual pursuits outside of established religions contain the idea of Christ consciousness. The most successful Mormons to emerge from Mormonism adhere to this idea, yet David's disdain for anyone leveling up and changing beliefs that separate themselves from the Mormon church doesn't fill me with confidence that he is on the right path. 

From the mindset of defenders of the faith, to the valid reasons to leave it, this video touches on all the aspects of a messy faith crisis being able to trust yourself as voices like David's shout in ignorance about things they simply know nothing about. 

Clips from this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iRWezuXPBrk&t=1029s

episodes.title: The Untold Story of the 1995 LDS Women's Conference
episodes.description:
I talk about Mormon influencers on their beliefs about Mormonism and how they perceive the church, namely Tammy Hill, a marriage and family therapist, who strongly believes that patriarchy is NOT the true order of Heaven. She argues that both biological sexes were created to help perfect one another through the power of the savior's atonement. 

I delve into the 1995 Women's Conference, where the LDS church had been filing amicus briefs to stop same-sex marriage in Hawaii. It's troubling to note that the women in leadership were never consulted on what should go into the proclamation on the family. The women were blindsided by the battle about same-sex marriage and the church's influence on this matter and we have the interviews to prove it.

episodes.title: Embracing a Life Without Mormon Spiritual Experiences w/ Bill Reel
episodes.description:
Link to Bill’s event: https://donorbox.org/events/455119
Wanting your spiritual experiences to be true? Don't we all. Wanting them to mean the Mormon church was restored by a God who had to utilize the same tactics of other sex cults and tell its leaders to marry other people's wives and children? You don't really believe that, right? If so, you're in good company with me and Bill Reel as we discuss what to do with those Mormon spiritual experiences.

No stone is left unturned in this video. We go into the framework we operated within once upon a time that led us to believe Mormon God was all up in our business to make us feel special. The thread of truth we still hold onto about being interconnected. The nature of God, truth, well-being, drugs, and, of course, its embodiment in Taylor Swift. 

Bill Reel and I discuss Mormon spirituality and post-Mormon spirituality. @MormonDiscussion

episodes.title: Joseph Smith's Polygamy | Uncovering the Toxic Aftermath for Mormons
episodes.description:
Ask a missionary, a bishop, an apostle for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints about if the church still practices polygamy and you'll likely get a "Whoa, whoa hey now, we discontinued the practice of polygamy in 1890. Since then, the church has strictly adhered to monogamy! Monogamy I tell you!" But much like a lot of aspects in Mormonism, that's not the full truth. For this deeper dive, I chat with my friend and Ex-Mormon community building icon, Chelsea Homer, about the groundbreaking book "The Ghosts of Eternal Polygamy" by faithful Mormon author Carol Lynn Pearson. 

To find post-Mormon community, check out Lost and Found Club: https://www.lostandfound.club/ 
My sketch on Mormon gender role reversal: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0RktADKrRyE

episodes.title: Angry Mormons Lash Out. "You're NO BETTER Than Blackface!" Ex-Mormons Respond :)
episodes.description:
This is my favorite video I've ever done. For this very special explanation on why I satirize and joke about the Mormon church the way I do, ExMormon hero of mine and cartoon mouse, Tanner Gilliland brings his insights. Just four short years ago, I was a faithful Mormon girl who covenanted for life to put off all loud laughter and never speak ill of the Lord's anointed. Likewise, I had two of the funniest and wisest apostates blocked on all the platforms, Tanner and Samantha.  @ZelphOntheShelf  

But your old girl NuanceHoe can't snuff down her critical thinking, empathy, and love of the laugh. Not with YouTube algorithms these days. After finally being open to what ExMormon's gripes with the church were, I clicked on one of Tanner and Samantha's videos. I've been thinking critically, empathic owning, and ironically laughing ever since. My videos aren't for everybody, and they aren't supposed to be. (But if you're the YouTube/Instagram/TikTok algorithm reading that, she's joking.)

episodes.title: My Mormon Mom Gave Me a Book on Faith Crisis to Get Me Back. Exposing the Author’s Lies Instead.
episodes.description:
We’re gonna have some FUN. The mother of all videos on how Joseph Smith was absolutely, without a doubt, 100% a treasure digger. Tons of time and research went into this one, a few bucks on my Patreon from a few people really makes it all worth it. https://www.patreon.com/nuancehoe

When it comes to destroying Hannah Stoddard’s statements, I leave no stone unturned! Or hat unlooked in. 🎩🪄

Check out PART 1 for more context!!
“I left Mormon Stories Podcast on an LDS Fundie Overdose. Here's the deal with Rod, John, and Jenn.”
https://youtu.be/inRBWQeCrGM 

🙋‍♀️Today I’ll be answering:

🪨 What is this fundie science-denying side of Mormonism? And why do they believe what they believe? Where do they get off? 

🪨 What is treasure digging? Was Joseph Smith defrauding people with a stone before founding The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints? And what sources can I trust? 

🪨 Does it mean he wasn’t a prophet? Is treasure digging doctrinal orrrrr occultic? 

🪨 How many times can NuanceHoe make me laugh in 3 hours while providing life changing insights, research, and sources on Mormon history? 

You’ve maybe seen Hannah Stoddard on her latest appearance on Midnight Mormons “debunk” this very inconvenient truth. 

You’ve maybe seen her on the back cover of that book your Mormon parents gave you called “Faith Crisis” with the weird, sultry girl on the cover whose eyes follow you wherever you go. 

But if you have ultra right-wing traditionalist Mormon parents and you happen to be an ex-Mormon, you have no doubt seen Hannah haphazardly glued over your face in your family photos. 

This is my life’s work! Thanks for watching!

episodes.title: My vagina’s exit from Mormonism: Christian vs Atheist childbirth // STORYTIME
episodes.description:
🎀Vibe Giveaway🎀
https://www.bboutique.co/vibe/carahburrell-yt
💄 You are link hunting for that FREE TOY or GIFT CARD from Bellesa, aren't you? 💄 You heard correct that everyone who signs up to my giveaway wins something. Will it be a toy? Will it be a gift card? *cues Greedy from Ariana Grande* Come get one! I said the word "and" when referring to the toy and gift card situation, I just get so excited and want to clarify it's more of an "or" "one or the other" situation. But totally amazing and legit and you deserve it after reading this whole paragraph. I love you. 
________________________________________________________________________________________
It’s storytime. I barely had the words for this video, but thankfully my bestest bud Samantha of  @ZelphOntheShelf  helped me explain the journey with a lot of laughs and tears. What do you do when you deconstruct your faith and don't know where to pull strength from? (And there's literally a tiny human coming out of you....) This is the story of my life in Mormonism, the Christ-centered births that meant so much to me, and where you go when you can't go back. This is a really special topic to me and I hope it resonates!

episodes.title: What A (Mormon) Cult Leader Sounds Like
episodes.description:
Buckle in for a full presentation + clip show and thorough dissection of the most recent talk in the Mormon authoritarian mind virus by Elder Kevin S. Hamilton called "Why a Church?". The mind-numbing culty-ness is again on display as I highlight all the ways the church set up a system where their members are so desperate for the promised peace and spirituality and salvation, yet are shut down for doubting the leaders, with no way to be in tune with actual peace or spirituality. Why? Because Mormons only think they HAVE IT when they are following the leaders with exactness. What good is your life if you have no grounds to say for yourself “This is wrong. This doesn’t bring peace.” without the threat of losing your eternal salvation and family? What good is your life if you haven’t learned true morality because your Mormon leaders have made those choices about what’s right and wrong for you? It's a new style of live-streaming I'm trying to do regularly so enjoy!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VKaPqQDbe9s&t=1409s
